ResourceHeader.Description: The Christchurch Ionosonde station near Christchurch, New Zealand, had ionosondes since August of 1942. They are IPS 4D between 08/1994 and 10/2011, CADI between 01/2014 and 04/2014, IPS 5D since 05/2012 to 01/2014. The ionosonde information before 08/1994 is not avaiable. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale.
